result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Smerling was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
No Huber and to commence immediately.  Court grants the defendant sentence credit since he was picked up on friday night (01/29/2016).
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael J Smerling
Current: 148 S. State St, Berlin, WI 54923 United States  (Effective: 02-16-2016)
Prior: 128 S State St, Berlin, WI 54923
JOC and final paperwork has been returned.  Return to sender.  No such number.  Unable to Forward.  Re-sent to:  148 S. State St  Berlin, WI  54923
to the defendant with Notice of Right to seek postconviction relief forms to be signed and returned
Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County and without counsel.

12:44 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County and without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  DA recites offer - upon plea to the charge, will recommend jail time and court costs.  Defendant will accept the offer.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  Defendant waives personal appearance in court for the sentencing.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-Court costs - Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-4 days county jail, with credit since picked up on friday - per jail calculation.  Sentence to commence immediately.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 12:55 p.m.
